clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Normal Values of Esophagogastric Junction (EGJ) Distensibility in Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Normal Values of Esophagogastric Junction (EGJ) Distensibility in Healthy Volunteers

oversight_info.authority: Netherlands: The Central Committee on Research Involving Human Subjects (CCMO)

brief_summary.textblock: To assess normal values of EGJ distensibility in healthy volunteers.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: normal values of esophagogastric junction (EGJ) distensibility (mm2/mmHg) in healthy volunteers as measured with the EndoFLIP device
primary_outcome.description: EGJ distensibility as measured by the index of the narrowest cross sectional area (mm2) and the corresponding intrabag pressure (mmHg)

secondary_outcome.measure: Establishing a cut-off value of EGJ distensibility (mm2/mmHg) based on the 90% percentile distribution of measurements performed in healthy volunteers.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. No history of gastrointestinal disease, especially gastro-esophageal reflux disease
2. BMI = 18-30 kg/m²
3. Caucasian race
4. Subject signed the informed consent form and is able to adhere to study protocol
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Age < 18 years
2. Previous esophageal or gastric surgery
3. Co-morbidities (including cardiopulmonary disease, collagen diseases, obesity, coagulation disorders and co-morbidity hindering upper gastrointestinal endoscopy)
4. Patients using anticoagulants
5. Patients unable to give informed consent
6. Smoking
7. History of alcohol abuse or current excessive alcohol consumption (> 2 alcoholic beverages per day or > 14 alcoholic beverages per week)
